|timezone = [[North American Eastern Time Zone|Eastern (EST)]] |utc_offset = -5 |timezone_DST = EDT |utc_offset_DST = -4 <!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = |website = |footnotes = }} '''Venango Township''' is a township in [[Butler County, Pennsylvania|Butler County]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States]]. The population was 732 at the 2000 census. ==Geography== According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the township has a total area of 20.8 square miles (53.7 km²), all of it land. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 732 people, 277 households, and 216 families residing in the township. The [[population density]] was 35.3 people per square mile (13.6/km²). There were 348 housing units at an average density of 16.8/sq mi (6.5/km²). The racial makeup of the township was 98.9% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 0.1% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 0.1% [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], and 0.5% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 0.2% of the population. There were 277 households out of which 35.4% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 65.7% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 5.4% had a female householder with no husband present, and 21.7% were non-families. 18.4% of all households were made up of individuals and 6.9% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.60 and the average family size was 2.94. In the township the population was spread out with 25.7% under the age of 18, 6.7% from 18 to 24, 29.2% from 25 to 44, 25.1% from 45 to 64, and 13.3% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 38 years. For every 100 females there were 119.2 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 114.2 males. The median income for a household in the township was $34,107, and the median income for a family was $38,214. Males had a median income of $30,938 versus $20,694 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the township was $14,600. About 10.0% of families and 11.6% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 9.9% of those under age 18 and 15.7% of those age 65 or over. ==References== <references /> {{Pittsburgh Metro Area}} {{Butler County, Pennsylvania}} {{coord|41|08|32|N|79|50|40|W|type:city_region:US-PA_source:GNIS-enwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Populated places established in 1797]] [[Category:Pittsburgh metropolitan area]] [[Category:Townships in Butler County, Pennsylvania]]
